page.title: 19THE GNOLL PARK, NEATH
page.content: The Gnoll Park is a popular recreational area for the inhabitants of Neath town . The local authority is responsible for the maintenance of the park, woodland and ponds contained within the grounds. There is an obstacle course, children's play area with swings, roundabout and slides,a pitch and putt golf course, four ponds and several woodland walks. The largest pond is used for coarse fishing and is stocked with perch, rudd, tench and carp. A special licence is required to fish here but this is not expensive or difficult to obtain. This pond is also stocked with a small number of exotic wildfowl including a black swan. The park is often used by people walking their dogs and by joggers keeping fit. Many wild birds breed in the park. There are several exotic trees,e.g.redwoods.
